intro: Tragia hildebrandtii, commonly known as the Hildebrandt's tragia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often succulent, aiding in water retention, while its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Tragia hildebrandtii is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in regions with low rainfall.
